segment.source: 5145(S, F) A network share object was checked to see whether client can be granted desired access.
segment.target: 5145(S, F) A network share object was checked to see whether client can be granted desired access.

segment.source: Describes security event 5145(S, F) A network share object was checked to see whether client can be granted desired access.
segment.target: Describes security event 5145(S, F) A network share object was checked to see whether client can be granted desired access.

segment.source: 5145(S, F): A network share object was checked to see whether client can be granted desired access.
segment.target: 5145(S, F): A network share object was checked to see whether client can be granted desired access.

segment.source: This event generates every time network share object (file or folder) was accessed.
segment.target: This event generates every time network share object (file or folder) was accessed.

segment.source: Important: Failure events are generated only when access is denied at the file share level.
segment.target: Important: Failure events are generated only when access is denied at the file share level.

segment.source: No events are generated if access was denied on the file system (NTFS) level.
segment.target: No events are generated if access was denied on the file system (NTFS) level.

segment.source: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.
segment.target: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.

segment.source: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista.
segment.target: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista.

segment.source: Security ID Type = SID: SID of account that requested access to network share object.
segment.target: Security ID Type = SID: SID of account that requested access to network share object.

segment.source: Event Viewer automatically tries to resolve SIDs and show the account name.
segment.target: Event Viewer automatically tries to resolve SIDs and show the account name.

segment.source: If the SID cannot be resolved, you will see the source data in the event.
segment.target: If the SID cannot be resolved, you will see the source data in the event.

segment.source: Note A security identifier (SID) is a unique value of variable length used to identify a trustee (security principal).
segment.target: Note A security identifier (SID) is a unique value of variable length used to identify a trustee (security principal).

segment.source: Each account has a unique SID that is issued by an authority, such as an Active Directory domain controller, and stored in a security database.
segment.target: Each account has a unique SID that is issued by an authority, such as an Active Directory domain controller, and stored in a security database.

segment.source: Each time a user logs on, the system retrieves the SID for that user from the database and places it in the access token for that user.
segment.target: Each time a user logs on, the system retrieves the SID for that user from the database and places it in the access token for that user.

segment.source: The system uses the SID in the access token to identify the user in all subsequent interactions with Windows security.
segment.target: The system uses the SID in the access token to identify the user in all subsequent interactions with Windows security.

segment.source: When a SID has been used as the unique identifier for a user or group, it cannot ever be used again to identify another user or group.
segment.target: When a SID has been used as the unique identifier for a user or group, it cannot ever be used again to identify another user or group.

segment.source: For more information about SIDs, see Security identifiers.
segment.target: For more information about SIDs, see Security identifiers.

segment.source: Account Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of the account that requested access to network share object.
segment.target: Account Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of the account that requested access to network share object.

segment.source: Account Domain Type = UnicodeString: subject’s domain or computer name.
segment.target: Account Domain Type = UnicodeString: subject’s domain or computer name.

segment.source: Formats vary, and include the following:
segment.target: Formats vary, and include the following:

segment.source: For some well-known security principals, such as LOCAL SERVICE or ANONYMOUS LOGON, the value of this field is “NT AUTHORITY”.
segment.target: For some well-known security principals, such as LOCAL SERVICE or ANONYMOUS LOGON, the value of this field is “NT AUTHORITY”.

segment.source: For local user accounts, this field will contain the name of the computer or device that this account belongs to, for example: “Win81”.
segment.target: For local user accounts, this field will contain the name of the computer or device that this account belongs to, for example: “Win81”.

segment.source: Logon ID Type = HexInt64: hexadecimal value that can help you correlate this event with recent events that might contain the same Logon ID, for example, “4624: An account was successfully logged on.”
segment.target: Logon ID Type = HexInt64: hexadecimal value that can help you correlate this event with recent events that might contain the same Logon ID, for example, “4624: An account was successfully logged on.”

segment.source: Object Type Type = UnicodeString: The type of an object that was accessed during the operation.
segment.target: Object Type Type = UnicodeString: The type of an object that was accessed during the operation.

segment.source: The following table contains the list of the most common Object Types:
segment.target: The following table contains the list of the most common Object Types:

segment.source: Source Address Type = UnicodeString: source IP address from which access was performed.
segment.target: Source Address Type = UnicodeString: source IP address from which access was performed.

segment.source: IPv6 address or ::ffff:IPv4 address of a client.
segment.target: IPv6 address or ::ffff:IPv4 address of a client.

segment.source: Source Port Type = UnicodeString: source TCP or UDP port which was used from remote or local machine to request the access.
segment.target: Source Port Type = UnicodeString: source TCP or UDP port which was used from remote or local machine to request the access.

segment.source: Share Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of accessed network share.
segment.target: Share Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of accessed network share.

segment.source: Share Path Type = UnicodeString: the full system (NTFS) path for accessed share.
segment.target: Share Path Type = UnicodeString: the full system (NTFS) path for accessed share.

segment.source: Can be empty, for example for Share Name: IPC$.
segment.target: Can be empty, for example for Share Name: IPC$.

segment.source: Relative Target Name Type = UnicodeString: relative name of the accessed target file or folder.
segment.target: Relative Target Name Type = UnicodeString: relative name of the accessed target file or folder.

segment.source: This file-path is relative to the network share.
segment.target: This file-path is relative to the network share.

segment.source: If access was requested for the share itself, then this field appears as “”.
segment.target: If access was requested for the share itself, then this field appears as “”.

segment.source: Access Mask Type = HexInt32: the sum of hexadecimal values of requested access rights.
segment.target: Access Mask Type = HexInt32: the sum of hexadecimal values of requested access rights.

segment.source: for different hexadecimal values for access rights.
segment.target: for different hexadecimal values for access rights.

segment.source: Accesses Type = UnicodeString: the list of access rights which were requested by SubjectSecurity ID.
segment.target: Accesses Type = UnicodeString: the list of access rights which were requested by SubjectSecurity ID.

segment.source: These access rights depend on Object Type.
segment.target: These access rights depend on Object Type.

segment.source: ReadData - For a file object, the right to read the corresponding file data.
segment.target: ReadData - For a file object, the right to read the corresponding file data.

segment.source: For a directory object, the right to read the corresponding directory data.
segment.target: For a directory object, the right to read the corresponding directory data.

segment.source: ListDirectory - For a directory, the right to list the contents of the directory.
segment.target: ListDirectory - For a directory, the right to list the contents of the directory.

segment.source: WriteData - For a file object, the right to write data to the file.
segment.target: WriteData - For a file object, the right to write data to the file.

segment.source: For a directory object, the right to create a file in the directory (FILEADDFILE).
segment.target: For a directory object, the right to create a file in the directory (FILEADDFILE).

segment.source: AddFile - For a directory, the right to create a file in the directory.
segment.target: AddFile - For a directory, the right to create a file in the directory.

segment.source: AppendData - For a file object, the right to append data to the file.
segment.target: AppendData - For a file object, the right to append data to the file.

segment.source: (For local files, write operations will not overwrite existing data if this flag is specified without FILEWRITEDATA.) For a directory object, the right to create a subdirectory (FILEADDSUBDIRECTORY).
segment.target: (For local files, write operations will not overwrite existing data if this flag is specified without FILEWRITEDATA.) For a directory object, the right to create a subdirectory (FILEADDSUBDIRECTORY).

segment.source: AddSubdirectory - For a directory, the right to create a subdirectory.
segment.target: AddSubdirectory - For a directory, the right to create a subdirectory.

segment.source: CreatePipeInstance - For a named pipe, the right to create a pipe.
segment.target: CreatePipeInstance - For a named pipe, the right to create a pipe.

segment.source: The right to read extended file attributes.
segment.target: The right to read extended file attributes.

segment.source: The right to write extended file attributes.
segment.target: The right to write extended file attributes.

segment.source: Execute - For a native code file, the right to execute the file.
segment.target: Execute - For a native code file, the right to execute the file.

segment.source: This access right given to scripts may cause the script to be executable, depending on the script interpreter.
segment.target: This access right given to scripts may cause the script to be executable, depending on the script interpreter.

segment.source: Traverse - For a directory, the right to traverse the directory.
segment.target: Traverse - For a directory, the right to traverse the directory.

segment.source: By default, users are assigned the BYPASSTRAVERSECHECKINGprivilege, which ignores the FILETRAVERSEaccess right.
segment.target: By default, users are assigned the BYPASSTRAVERSECHECKINGprivilege, which ignores the FILETRAVERSEaccess right.

segment.source: See the remarks in File Security and Access Rights for more information.
segment.target: See the remarks in File Security and Access Rights for more information.

segment.source: For a directory, the right to delete a directory and all the files it contains, including read-only files.
segment.target: For a directory, the right to delete a directory and all the files it contains, including read-only files.

segment.source: The right to read file attributes.
segment.target: The right to read file attributes.

segment.source: The right to write file attributes.
segment.target: The right to write file attributes.

segment.source: The right to delete the object.
segment.target: The right to delete the object.

segment.source: The right to read the information in the object's security descriptor, not including the information in the system access control list (SACL).
segment.target: The right to read the information in the object's security descriptor, not including the information in the system access control list (SACL).

segment.source: The right to modify the discretionary access control list (DACL) in the object's security descriptor.
segment.target: The right to modify the discretionary access control list (DACL) in the object's security descriptor.

segment.source: The right to change the owner in the object's security descriptor
segment.target: The right to change the owner in the object's security descriptor

segment.source: The right to use the object for synchronization.
segment.target: The right to use the object for synchronization.

segment.source: This enables a thread to wait until the object is in the signaled state.
segment.target: This enables a thread to wait until the object is in the signaled state.

segment.source: Some object types do not support this access right.
segment.target: Some object types do not support this access right.

segment.source: The ACCESSSYSSEC access right controls the ability to get or set the SACL in an object's security descriptor.
segment.target: The ACCESSSYSSEC access right controls the ability to get or set the SACL in an object's security descriptor.

segment.source: Access Check Results Type = UnicodeString: the list of access check results.
segment.target: Access Check Results Type = UnicodeString: the list of access check results.

segment.source: The format of the result is:
segment.target: The format of the result is:

segment.source: REQUESTEDACCESS – the name of requested access.
segment.target: REQUESTEDACCESS – the name of requested access.

segment.source: See Table of file access codes, earlier in this topic.
segment.target: See Table of file access codes, earlier in this topic.

segment.source: Granted by – if access was granted.
segment.target: Granted by – if access was granted.

segment.source: Denied by – if access was denied.
segment.target: Denied by – if access was denied.

segment.source: ACEWHICH ALLOWEDORDENIEDACCESS: the Security Descriptor Definition Language (SDDL) value for Access Control Entry (ACE), which granted or denied access.
segment.target: ACEWHICH ALLOWEDORDENIEDACCESS: the Security Descriptor Definition Language (SDDL) value for Access Control Entry (ACE), which granted or denied access.

segment.source: Note The Security Descriptor Definition Language (SDDL) defines string elements for enumerating information contained in the security descriptor.
segment.target: Note The Security Descriptor Definition Language (SDDL) defines string elements for enumerating information contained in the security descriptor.

segment.source: SID of specific security principal, or reserved (pre-defined) value, for example: BA (BUILTINADMINISTRATORS), WD (Everyone), SY (LOCALSYSTEM), etc. See the list of possible values in the table below.
segment.target: SID of specific security principal, or reserved (pre-defined) value, for example: BA (BUILTINADMINISTRATORS), WD (Everyone), SY (LOCALSYSTEM), etc. See the list of possible values in the table below.

segment.source: SDDL values for Access Control Entry
segment.target: SDDL values for Access Control Entry

segment.source: "P” - SDDLPROTECTED, Inheritance from containers that are higher in the folder hierarchy are blocked.
segment.target: "P” - SDDLPROTECTED, Inheritance from containers that are higher in the folder hierarchy are blocked.

segment.source: "AI" - SDDLAUTOINHERITED, Inheritance is allowed, assuming that "P" Is not also set.
segment.target: "AI" - SDDLAUTOINHERITED, Inheritance is allowed, assuming that "P" Is not also set.

segment.source: "AR" - SDDLAUTOINHERITREQ, Child objects inherit permissions from this object.
segment.target: "AR" - SDDLAUTOINHERITREQ, Child objects inherit permissions from this object.

segment.source: "OA" - OBJECT ACCESS ALLOWED: only applies to a subset of the object(s).
segment.target: "OA" - OBJECT ACCESS ALLOWED: only applies to a subset of the object(s).

segment.source: "OD" - OBJECT ACCESS DENIED: only applies to a subset of the object(s).
segment.target: "OD" - OBJECT ACCESS DENIED: only applies to a subset of the object(s).

segment.source: "CI" - CONTAINER INHERIT: Child objects that are containers, such as directories, inherit the ACE as an explicit ACE.
segment.target: "CI" - CONTAINER INHERIT: Child objects that are containers, such as directories, inherit the ACE as an explicit ACE.

segment.source: "OI" - OBJECT INHERIT: Child objects that are not containers inherit the ACE as an explicit ACE.
segment.target: "OI" - OBJECT INHERIT: Child objects that are not containers inherit the ACE as an explicit ACE.

segment.source: "NP" - NO PROPAGATE: only immediate children inherit this ace.
segment.target: "NP" - NO PROPAGATE: only immediate children inherit this ace.

segment.source: "IO" - INHERITANCE ONLY: ace doesn’t apply to this object, but may affect children via inheritance.
segment.target: "IO" - INHERITANCE ONLY: ace doesn’t apply to this object, but may affect children via inheritance.

segment.source: rights: A hexadecimal string which denotes the access mask or reserved value, for example: FA (File All Access), FX (File Execute), FW (File Write), etc.
segment.target: rights: A hexadecimal string which denotes the access mask or reserved value, for example: FA (File All Access), FX (File Execute), FW (File Write), etc.

segment.source: accountsid: SID of specific security principal, or reserved value, for example: AN (Anonymous), WD (Everyone), SY (LOCALSYSTEM), etc. See the table above for more details.
segment.target: accountsid: SID of specific security principal, or reserved value, for example: AN (Anonymous), WD (Everyone), SY (LOCALSYSTEM), etc. See the table above for more details.

segment.source: For more information about SDDL syntax, see these articles: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc230374.aspx, https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/hardware/aa374892(v=vs.85).aspx.
segment.target: For more information about SDDL syntax, see these articles: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc230374.aspx, https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/hardware/aa374892(v=vs.85).aspx.

segment.source: For 5145(S, F): A network share object was checked to see whether client can be granted desired access.
segment.target: For 5145(S, F): A network share object was checked to see whether client can be granted desired access.

segment.source: Important For this event, also see Appendix A: Security monitoring recommendations for many audit events.
segment.target: Important For this event, also see Appendix A: Security monitoring recommendations for many audit events.

segment.source: Monitor this event if the Network InformationSource Address is not from your internal IP range.
segment.target: Monitor this event if the Network InformationSource Address is not from your internal IP range.

segment.source: Monitor this event if the Network InformationSource Address should not be able to connect with the specific computer (Computer:).
segment.target: Monitor this event if the Network InformationSource Address should not be able to connect with the specific computer (Computer:).

segment.source: If you have critical files or folders on specific network shares, for which you need to monitor access attempts (Success and Failure), monitor for specific Share InformationShare Name and Share InformationRelative Target Name.
segment.target: If you have critical files or folders on specific network shares, for which you need to monitor access attempts (Success and Failure), monitor for specific Share InformationShare Name and Share InformationRelative Target Name.

segment.source: If you have domain or local accounts that should only be able to access a specific list of shared files or folders, you can monitor for access attempts outside the allowed list.
segment.target: If you have domain or local accounts that should only be able to access a specific list of shared files or folders, you can monitor for access attempts outside the allowed list.

segment.source: We recommend that you monitor for these Access Request InformationAccesses rights (especially for Failure):
segment.target: We recommend that you monitor for these Access Request InformationAccesses rights (especially for Failure):
